description.narrative: The overall development objective of the program is to improve the quality and sustainability of urban transport systems in Argentine Metropolitan Areas, through the improvement of sectoral decision making frameworks and by giving priority to public transport modes in the urban transport sector. The project (APL1) development objectives contribute to the overall program development objective by: (i) supporting the design and creation of a multijurisdictional Metropolitan Transport Agency for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area (AMBA); (ii) strengthening the institutional capacity of the transport authorities in decision making, planning, priority setting, and resource allocation in urban transport; (iii) improving the quality and performance of urban transport infrastructure and/orservices in medium size Metropolitan Areas; and (iv) improving the physical integration and access to public transport networks in the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area.

title.narrative: Segregated corridor constructed in Argentina's medium size Metropolitan Areas that provides a 10% reduction in generalized cost of travel.
Improved mobility in the La Matanza BRT Juan Manuel de Rosas which provides at least a 10% reduction in generalized cost of travel.
Improvement of access conditions in trains stations in AMBA.
Kilometers of segregated bus lanes constructed in the AMBA.
Produce transport planning instruments based on systematic data collection such as: Urban Transport Planning Model, Transportation Master Plan, and/or Urban Transport Center or Observatory.
Existence of a portfolio of projects with feasibility studies or detailed designs for the implementation of projects in Metropolitan Areas of Argentina.
Number of Metropolitan Areas with updated OD Home Mobility Surveys.
Kilometers of segregated bus lanes constructed in Metropolitan Areas of Argentina.
Number of minutes of the AMT meetings per year.
Evidence of AMT performance, such as: creating a project with inter-jurisdictional participation and/or inter-jurisdictional agreements on specific transport issues.
Existence of a legal agreement for creating the AMT, signed inter-jurisdictionally.
Existence of a valid statute for the internal organization of the AMT and appointed representatives for each jurisdiction.
Post-graduate course in urban transport is approved and created by Buenos Aires University.
Reduction in travel time for at grade public transit users due to the removal of the Saenz Transfer Station level crossings.
General progress of the Saenz Transfer Station civil works.
Increase in number of public transit users in the La Matanza BRT.
